main_definition: A monitor is a device used to display output from a computer or to supervise, observe, or keep track of something.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To watch over and check regularly (something), especially for problems or issues
meanings_and_examples.example: The manager monitors the progress of the project to ensure it stays on schedule.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A screen used in computers, televisions, etc., displaying information provided by a computer program
meanings_and_examples.example: She adjusted her monitor's brightness and contrast settings for better visibility.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To keep track of or observe the behavior of an animal (especially those in captivity)
meanings_and_examples.example: The zookeeper monitors the primates to ensure they are healthy and not showing signs of distress.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A person employed to monitor the activities, progress, or performance of a particular task or group
meanings_and_examples.example: An IT specialist was hired as a monitor for our network security team.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To check (a device or system) periodically to ensure it is working properly
meanings_and_examples.example: The technician monitors the server every hour to prevent any potential issues.
